column4: nvidia driver doesn't seem to be working.  I installed nvidia-glx, ran dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xfree86 where I selected the nvidia driver, and deselected loading dri and glx.  But according to my careful, scientific graphics driver evaluation (run tuxracer), it didn't work.  What am I missing?
Oh, and I logged out and back in again after I reconfigured the X server.
I think the driver is supposed to allow these functions to be performed by the card.
But the real reason that I deselected them is because someone here said to!  (I already forget--was that deft?)
you'll need glx; it's GLcore and dri that you need to disable IIRC.
you have to enable glx and disable GLcore and dri.
nvidia's binary is special, it doesn't use dri.

But the X server configuration program specifically said that GLCore and glx enable software rendering.  Isn't the point of the card to do the rendering in hardware--so these modules are not necessary?
I'm not sure what the X configuration program says, but the nvidia-glx package provides an accelerated glx.
Yes, and I think that is why glx does not have be be done in software in X, since the card will do it.
that means it's renedering in software right now.
I'm still wondering about the comment in the X configuration program about the mesa libraries.  In synaptic I see a package mesag3, which I do not have installed.
you don't want mesa (software-only on nvidia cards), nvidia-glx should provide its own libGL.
So far, none of the combinations worked.
you're using the nvidia driver, not nv, right?
Yes, each time I run dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xfree86, I select the nvidia driver.
